OOC: All right he yelled at me to reply from the Pred base, which is 
impossible since I have no one there, so this is the return of Ender.  Ender 
has a long and complicated backstory that I will write as a flashback 
sometime when it is cooler in this room ... for now we join him at the end of 
his escape from an unknown planet.

::Ender::
       He looked around him, his ship was damaged, irreparably from the 
blast.  He would need somewhere to set down.  He began scanning for the 
nearest planetary system.  "Well, the five closest ones are out of the 
question, after I blew up that planet ... well they're not to happy to see 
me."  He begins scanning for the nearest uninhabited system.  "A star, Sol 
... hmm... 9 planets ... one of them supports life, one may or may not ... 
hard to tell at this range."  He nods.

       "That is my destination, the third planet in the Sol system."  He 
engages his engines which slowly moan to life and sets his course towards 
Earth.  It wasn't a particularly long journey but his traditional faster than 
light engines did make the relativity rather annoying, pushing him backwards 
in time.  He sighs.  "Oh well."

       As he nears the planet he tries to shut off the engines and finds them 
unresponsive.  "Ah, slag.  This is no good."  He frantically scrambles to fix 
the controls with no success.  So he walks back to where the engines are 
housed and kicks the casing.  The engines sputter and die ... and his ship 
crashes into the planet, remarkably close to Proto.

--part1_9e.28a821ba.2a51f218_boundary
Content-Type: text/html; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

<HTML><FONT FACE=arial,helvetica><FONT  SIZE=2>OOC: All right he yelled at me to reply from the Pred base, which is impossible since I have no one there, so this is the return of Ender.  Ender has a long and complicated backstory that I will write as a flashback sometime when it is cooler in this room ... for now we join him at the end of his escape from an unknown planet.
<BR>
<BR>::Ender::
<BR>       He looked around him, his ship was damaged, irreparably from the blast.  He would need somewhere to set down.  He began scanning for the nearest planetary system.  "Well, the five closest ones are out of the question, after I blew up that planet ... well they're not to happy to see me."  He begins scanning for the nearest uninhabited system.  "A star, Sol ... hmm... 9 planets ... one of them supports life, one may or may not ... hard to tell at this range."  He nods.
<BR>
<BR>       "That is my destination, the third planet in the Sol system."  He engages his engines which slowly moan to life and sets his course towards Earth.  It wasn't a particularly long journey but his traditional faster than light engines did make the relativity rather annoying, pushing him backwards in time.  He sighs.  "Oh well."
<BR>
<BR>       As he nears the planet he tries to shut off the engines and finds them unresponsive.  "Ah, slag.  This is no good."  He frantically scrambles to fix the controls with no success.  So he walks back to where the engines are housed and kicks the casing.  The engines sputter and die ... and his ship crashes into the planet, remarkably close to Proto.</FONT></HTML>
